main event: A large, luminous mass was observed falling from the sky in Schlanders, Tirol, Italy on the evening of December 18, 1962.
interesting points: The observer, a Red Cross nurse at the Schlanders hospital, was unable to see the object hit the ground because a balcony wall obstructed the view from her window.
The observer asked the local forest ranger to keep an eye out during patrols in case the object landed in the mountains or woods.
Newspaper clippings were enclosed that reported a 24-hour watch being kept at the site where the luminous object fell to earth.
The observer was prompted to report the incident after reading the newspaper articles, wondering if there could be a connection.
The case was referred to the Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense for consideration and appropriate action.
witnesses: Red Cross nurse at the Schlanders hospital
